result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Fuchs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J. Fuchs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J. Fuchs was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim; no use or possession of any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Completion of sex offender treatment and COMPAS programming;  submission of DNA sample to the Iowa County Sheriff's Department; payment of court ordered financial obligations and supervision fees; random UAs & PBTs; completion of any other programming as deemed appropriate/necessary by the DOC; sex offender registration for the period of incarceration and extended supervision (total of 6 yrs) and compliance with all reporting proceedures.

**On May 2, 2017, JOC amended to order sex offender registration for 15 years after the completion of extended supervision.  Previously mentioned life time registration has been rescinded **

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael J. Fuchs not in court.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Record clarified:  sexual registration to be in place for 15 years after the completion of his extended supervision.
Hearing on May 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court, defendant Michael J. Fuchs not in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case to clarify the record - life time supervision is NOT determined by the Court, that was mentioned in error at sentencing.  Determination of when the registration is to commence.  State will review the letter from the DOC and then will clarify with the Court.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.
from DOC re clarification of 3/13/2017 JOC
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI received by the Court and all parties - no disputes.  Victim notifications have been attempted and established as well as possible - defense does not object - will proceed.    Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.  Recommendation of DOC:  6 yrs WSP (3 initial, 3 extended) plus conditions of no contact with victim, completion of sex offender and AODA treatment, completion of COMPAS, complete any programming as recommended, no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, random UAs and PBTs, restitution $1148.28, payment of court obligations and supervision fees, submission of DNA sample.   State advises they agree with the DOC recommendation and would stipulate to 461 days credit for time served - gives reasons.  Atty Angel responds.    Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.  Court advises defendant of restriction of firearm use/possession.  Defendant does not qualify for CIB or Sub Abuse programming.
*copy given to Atty Nelson and Atty Angel*
Sentencing hearing on March 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss count 1.  Defendant sworn.  PLQ - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  Ct 2: NC plea .  PSI ordered.  State stipulates to disposition will not exceed 4 yr initial confinement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court, defendant Michael J. Fuchs not in court, in custody @ Sauk County Jail.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for additional hearing to determine if defendant will plea.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from Court to defendant, in re. ex parte communications
Final pre-trial on October 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Angel filed motion to reduce bond.  Discussion on current situation/status and possible residence(s).  State opposes reduction of bond, gives reason(s).  Court denies motion to reduce bond.  Bond remains as cash bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail
Status conference on August 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court, defendant Michael J. Fuchs not in court, in custody.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in court, via video, with attorney Timothy Luke Angel.  Defendant Michael J. Fuchs in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has motioned the court to modify bond due to the defendant's pending release from MMHI.  Guardianship matter will be transfered to Iowa County to be overseen by DHS.   State requests $10000 cash bond reinstated - will amend to signature bond once placement can be secured w/ 24-7 supervision.  Atty Angel does not object as long as bond issue will be addressed upon security of the placement.  Court reinstates the bond:  $10,000 cash bond when released from MMHI.

No contact with Jane Doe (dob: 4-5-95); upon release from MMHI, defendant shall be held on this bond until placement in a 24/7 secured facility is in place and the Court can review and amend bond to signature bond.
